类型: Size: 17.3 inchColor: Quilted Black
评论详情: I spent a long time searching for a professional yet stylish backpack that could accommodate a 17" laptop. The reviews for this bag were excellent, and I loved the design and features. However, I'm giving it 3 stars instead of 5 due to issues with fit and functionality.  The Good:  *The design is sleek and professional. *The outer side pockets are spacious—perfect for an iPhone or a water bottle, with easy access. *The straps and fit are comfortable on my 5'3" frame. *It’s fairly lightweight and manageable, provided you're selective about what you carry.  The Not-So-Good:  *The bag is front-heavy, even when empty. Using all the front compartments makes it lean forward, which disrupts the balance. While I can counterbalance this by filling the main compartment, it defeats the purpose of having so many pockets. *The biggest issue: the laptop sleeve just barely accommodates a 17" laptop. With the laptop in place, the bag's capacity is severely limited. Overloading the main compartment makes the front flap misalign, and the zipper becomes impossible to close. *The rigid back panel exacerbates this issue, as it creates tension that affects the bag’s ability to close properly.  Final Thoughts: If you use a smaller laptop, this bag would be a 5-star purchase. However, for larger laptops, the limited capacity and balance issues are frustrating. I’m keeping the bag because it’s stylish and suitable for travel, but if you're buying it for a 17" laptop, be prepared to pack lightly and carefully.

类型: Size: 17.3 inchColor: Quilted Black
评论详情: As I sit here amongst my collection of backpacks, I felt compelled to write a review for the Vankean.  This is hands down the best and most functional backpack I've used.  The way the main compartment opens (like an old timey doctor's bag) makes everything accessible and I swear gives me 20% to 30% more room.  There are plenty of compartments to hold what I need and my full size water bottle fits in teh side pocket without an issue.  The ONLY thing I would fix is making the suitcase strap a little more heavy duty.  The backpack can tend to slide a little.  However, the strap is still going strong.  I travel several times a month & I might buy another one or two just to have in my inventory.  For reference, my $250 Travelpro elite is currently gathering dust.

I have been waiting to post a review to see how durable this bag would be.  I bought it several months ago now and I'm glad I did.  I use a backpack for my job.  I walk a mile to get to my building so I didn't want a heavy bag.  I wanted one that the straps wouldn't hurt my shoulders but were also well put together.  My last bag was hanging on by 2 literal threads for the last month.  So far the zippers work fine, it has 2 drink bottle holders- 1 on each side(a must for me).  I love the multiple pockets for being organized and the space inside is rather large.  My laptop along wtih multiple notepads and calendars and my small purse fit in it just fine.  It is a sturdy material and stands up well too.  Plus it was very affordable.  If you are a nurse or work in healthcare....you will understand why this is a good bag.
